message.content:
{"id": "50016", 
"title": "Bug 50016: Bad division of responsibility around isUserInRole and new Request login and logout methods", 
"description": "Bug 50016: Bad division of responsibility around isUserInRole and new Request login and logout methods

Created attachment 26089 [Details]: Improve division of responsibility for isUserInRole and login/logout methods

There are 2 similar problems that have a bad division of responsibility.

1. The Request.isUserInRole method tries to prevent jacc implementations and also behaves incorrectly. In the current Tomcat implementation, role ref mappings are first applied to the supplied role and then the target role is tested. However, jacc requires that this be implemented by constructing a role ref permission with the current servlet name and the supplied (not mapped) role.

", 
"OB": "The current implementation of Request.isUserInRole method has a bad division of responsibility. It tries to prevent jacc implementations and behaves incorrectly.", 
"EB": "The division of responsibility in the Request.isUserInRole method needs improvement. It should not try to prevent jacc implementations and should behave correctly in all scenarios.", 
"SR": "Aside from the spec language, consider a web app with two roles: A and B, and a servlet S that maps A to B and B to A."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '50016', 'title': 'Bug 50016bad division of responsibility around isUserInRole and new Request login and logout methods', 'description': 'Bug 50016bad division of responsibility around isUserInRole and new Request login and logout methods Created attachment 26089 [details]improve division of responsibility for isUserInRole and login/logout methodsThere are 2 similar problems that have a bad division of responsibility.1. Request.isUserInRole tries to prevent jacc implementations and is also wrong.In the current tomcat implementation, roleref mappings are first applied to the supplied role and then the target role is tested. jacc requires that this be implemented by constructing a roleref permission with the current servlet name and the supplied (not mapped) role. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': 'Aside from the spec language, consider a web app with two roles A and B and a servlet S that maps A to B and B to A. '}
